meanings.definition: To outwit or deceive someone by making them believe something that is not true.
meanings.sent1: She outbluffed her friend by pretending to have a secret treasure map.
meanings.sent2: He outbluffed his opponent in the poker game by pretending to have a winning hand.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox outbluffed the hunter by leading him on a wild goose chase.
meanings.sent4: The detective outbluffed the suspect into confessing to the crime.
meanings.sent5: The magician outbluffed the audience with his incredible disappearing act.

meanings.definition: To surpass in a bluffing competition.
meanings.sent1: She outbluffed all her friends in the game of poker.
meanings.sent2: He outbluffed his rival by convincing everyone of his false story.
meanings.sent3: The little boy outbluffed his classmates by claiming he had a pet dragon at home.
meanings.sent4: The con artist outbluffed everyone in the room with his elaborate scheme.
meanings.sent5: The politician outbluffed his opponents with his smooth talking and false promises.
